pokemons.name: Bulbasaur
pokemons.description: A strange seed was planted on its back at birth. The plant sprouts and grows with this Pokémon.

pokemons.name: Ivysaur
pokemons.description: When the bulb on its back grows large, it appears to lose the ability to stand on its hind legs.

pokemons.name: Venusaur
pokemons.description: The plant blooms when it is absorbing solar energy. It stays on the move to seek sunlight.

pokemons.name: Charmander
pokemons.description: Obviously prefers hot places. When it rains, steam is said to spout from the tip of its tail.

pokemons.name: Charmeleon
pokemons.description: When it swings its burning tail, it elevates the temperature to unbearably high levels.

pokemons.name: Charizard
pokemons.description: Spits fire that is hot enough to melt boulders. Known to cause forest fires unintentionally.

pokemons.name: Squirtle
pokemons.description: After birth, its back swells and hardens into a shell. Powerfully sprays foam from its mouth.

pokemons.name: Wartortle
pokemons.description: Often hides in water to stalk unwary prey. For swimming fast, it moves its ears to maintain balance.

pokemons.name: Blastoise
pokemons.description: A brutal Pokémon with pressurized water jets on its shell. They are used for high-speed tackles.

pokemons.name: Caterpie
pokemons.description: Its short feet are tipped with suction pads that enable it to tirelessly climb slopes and walls.

pokemons.name: Metapod
pokemons.description: The shell covering this Pokémon’s body is as hard as an iron slab. Metapod does not move very much.

pokemons.name: Butterfree
pokemons.description: In battle, it flaps its wings at high speed to release highly toxic dust into the air.

pokemons.name: Weedle
pokemons.description: Often found in forests, eating leaves. It has a sharp venomous stinger on its head.

pokemons.name: Kakuna
pokemons.description: Almost incapable of moving, this Pokémon can only harden its shell to protect itself from predators.

pokemons.name: Beedrill
pokemons.description: Flies at high speed and attacks using its large venomous stingers on its forelegs and tail.

pokemons.name: Pidgey
pokemons.description: A common sight in forests and woods. It flaps its wings at ground level to kick up blinding sand.

pokemons.name: Pidgeotto
pokemons.description: This Pokémon is full of vitality. It constantly flies around its large territory in search of prey.

pokemons.name: Pidgeot
pokemons.description: When hunting, it skims the surface of water at high speed to pick off unwary prey such as Magikarp.

pokemons.name: Rattata
pokemons.description: Bites anything when it attacks. Small and very quick, it is a common sight in many places.

pokemons.name: Raticate
pokemons.description: Its hind feet are webbed. They act as flippers, so it can swim in rivers and hunt for prey.

pokemons.name: Spearow
pokemons.description: Eats bugs in grassy areas. It has to flap its short wings at high speed to stay airborne.

pokemons.name: Fearow
pokemons.description: With its huge and magnificent wings, it can keep aloft without ever having to land for rest.

pokemons.name: Ekans
pokemons.description: Moves silently and stealthily. Eats the eggs of birds, such as Pidgey and Spearow, whole.

pokemons.name: Arbok
pokemons.description: The frightening patterns on its belly have been studied. Six variations have been confirmed.

pokemons.name: Pikachu
pokemons.description: It raises its tail to check its surroundings. The tail is sometimes struck by lightning in this pose.

pokemons.name: Raichu
pokemons.description: Its long tail serves as a ground to protect itself from its own high-voltage power.

pokemons.name: Sandshrew
pokemons.description: It lives in areas of limited rainfall. When danger approaches, it curls up into a ball to protect itself from foes.

pokemons.name: Sandslash
pokemons.description: It is skilled at slashing enemies with its claws. If broken, they start to grow back in a day.

pokemons.name: Nidoran♀
pokemons.description: Although small, its venomous barbs render this Pokémon dangerous. The female has smaller horns.

pokemons.name: Nidorina
pokemons.description: The female's horn develops slowly. Prefers physical attacks such as clawing and biting.

pokemons.name: Nidoqueen
pokemons.description: Its hard scales provide strong protection. It uses its hefty bulk to execute powerful moves.

pokemons.name: Nidoran♂
pokemons.description: Stiffens its ears to sense danger. The larger its horns, the more powerful its secreted venom.

pokemons.name: Nidorino
pokemons.description: An aggressive Pokémon that is quick to attack. The horn on its head secretes a powerful venom.

pokemons.name: Nidoking
pokemons.description: It uses its powerful tail in battle to smash, constrict, then break the prey’s bones.

pokemons.name: Clefairy
pokemons.description: Its magical and cute appeal has many admirers. It is rare and found only in certain areas.

pokemons.name: Clefable
pokemons.description: A timid fairy Pokémon that is rarely seen. It will run and hide the moment it senses people.

pokemons.name: Vulpix
pokemons.description: As it develops, its single white tail gains color and splits into six. It is quite warm and cuddly.

pokemons.name: Ninetales
pokemons.description: Very smart and very vengeful. Grabbing one of its many tails could result in a 1000-year curse.

pokemons.name: Jigglypuff
pokemons.description: When its huge eyes light up, it sings a mysteriously soothing melody that lulls its enemies to sleep.

pokemons.name: Wigglytuff
pokemons.description: The body is soft and rubbery. When angered, it will suck in air and inflate itself to an enormous size.

pokemons.name: Zubat
pokemons.description: Forms colonies in perpetually dark places. Uses ultrasonic waves to identify and approach targets.

pokemons.name: Golbat
pokemons.description: Once it strikes, it will not stop draining energy from the victim even if it gets too heavy to fly.

pokemons.name: Oddish
pokemons.description: During the day, it keeps its face buried in the ground. At night, it wanders around sowing its seeds.

pokemons.name: Gloom
pokemons.description: The smell from its drool-like syrup and the pollen on its petals is so bad, it may make opponents faint.

pokemons.name: Vileplume
pokemons.description: The larger its petals, the more toxic pollen it contains. Its big head is heavy and hard to hold up.

pokemons.name: Paras
pokemons.description: Burrows to suck tree roots. The mushrooms on its back grow by drawing nutrients from the bug host.

pokemons.name: Parasect
pokemons.description: A host-parasite pair in which the parasite mushroom has taken over the host bug. Prefers damp places.

pokemons.name: Venonat
pokemons.description: Lives in the shadows of tall trees where it eats bugs. It is attracted by light at night.

pokemons.name: Venomoth
pokemons.description: The dust-like scales covering its wings are color coded to indicate the kinds of poison it has.

pokemons.name: Diglett
pokemons.description: It burrows through the ground at a shallow depth. It leaves raised earth in its wake, making it easy to spot.

pokemons.name: Dugtrio
pokemons.description: A team of Diglett triplets. It triggers huge earthquakes by burrowing 60 miles underground.

pokemons.name: Meowth
pokemons.description: Adores circular objects. Wanders the streets on a nightly basis to look for dropped loose change.

pokemons.name: Persian
pokemons.description: Although its fur has many admirers, it is tough to raise as a pet because of its fickle meanness.

pokemons.name: Psyduck
pokemons.description: While lulling its enemies with its vacant look, this wily Pokémon will use psychokinetic powers.

pokemons.name: Golduck
pokemons.description: Often seen swimming elegantly by lake shores. It is often mistaken for the Japanese monster Kappa.

pokemons.name: Mankey
pokemons.description: Extremely quick to anger. It could be docile one moment, then thrashing away the next instant.

pokemons.name: Primeape
pokemons.description: Always furious and tenacious to boot. It will not abandon chasing its quarry until it catches up.

pokemons.name: Growlithe
pokemons.description: Very protective of its territory. It will bark and bite to repel intruders from its space.

pokemons.name: Arcanine
pokemons.description: A Pokémon that is described in Chinese legends. It is said to race across the land as it protects the weak and upholds justice.

pokemons.name: Poliwag
pokemons.description: Its newly grown legs prevent it from running. It appears to prefer swimming than trying to stand.

pokemons.name: Poliwhirl
pokemons.description: Capable of living in or out of water. When out of water, it sweats to keep its body slimy.

pokemons.name: Poliwrath
pokemons.description: An adept swimmer at both the front crawl and breaststroke. Easily overtakes the best human swimmers.

pokemons.name: Abra
pokemons.description: Using its ability to read minds, it will identify impending danger and teleport to safety.

pokemons.name: Kadabra
pokemons.description: It emits special alpha waves from its body that induce headaches just by being close by.

pokemons.name: Alakazam
pokemons.description: Its brain can outperform a supercomputer. Its intelligence quotient is said to be 5,000.

pokemons.name: Machop
pokemons.description: Loves to build its muscles. It trains in all styles of martial arts to become even stronger.

pokemons.name: Machoke
pokemons.description: Its muscular body is so powerful, it must wear a power-save belt to be able to regulate its motions.

pokemons.name: Machamp
pokemons.description: Using its heavy muscles, it throws powerful punches that can send the victim clear over the horizon.

pokemons.name: Bellsprout
pokemons.description: A carnivorous Pokémon that traps and eats bugs. It appears to use its root feet to replenish moisture.

pokemons.name: Weepinbell
pokemons.description: When hungry, it swallows anything that moves. Its hapless prey is melted inside by strong acids.

pokemons.name: Victreebel
pokemons.description: Lures prey with the sweet aroma of honey. Swallowed whole, the prey is melted in a day, bones and all.

pokemons.name: Tentacool
pokemons.description: Drifts in shallow seas. Anglers who hook them by accident are often punished by its stinging acid.

pokemons.name: Tentacruel
pokemons.description: The tentacles are normally kept short. On hunts, they are extended to ensnare and immobilize prey.

pokemons.name: Geodude
pokemons.description: Found in fields and mountains. Mistaking them for boulders, people often step or trip on them.

pokemons.name: Graveler
pokemons.description: Rolls down slopes to move. It rolls over any obstacle without slowing or changing its direction.

pokemons.name: Golem
pokemons.description: Its boulder-like body is extremely hard. It can easily withstand dynamite blasts without taking damage.

pokemons.name: Ponyta
pokemons.description: Capable of jumping incredibly high. Its hooves and sturdy legs absorb the impact of a hard landing.

pokemons.name: Rapidash
pokemons.description: Very competitive, this Pokémon will chase anything that moves fast in the hopes of racing it.

pokemons.name: Slowpoke
pokemons.description: Incredibly slow and sluggish. It is quite content to loll about without worrying about the time.

pokemons.name: Slowbro
pokemons.description: The Shellder that latches onto Slowpoke’s tail is said to feed on the host’s leftover scraps.

pokemons.name: Magnemite
pokemons.description: Uses antigravity to stay suspended. Appears without warning and uses Thunder Wave and similar moves.

pokemons.name: Magneton
pokemons.description: Formed by several Magnemite linked together. They frequently appear when sunspots flare up.

pokemons.name: Farfetch'd
pokemons.description: The plant stalk it holds is its weapon. The stalk is used like a sword to cut all sorts of things.

pokemons.name: Doduo
pokemons.description: A two-headed Pokémon that was discovered as a sudden mutation. It runs at a pace of over 60 miles per hour.

pokemons.name: Dodrio
pokemons.description: An odd species that is rarely found. The three heads respectively represent joy, sorrow, and anger.

pokemons.name: Seel
pokemons.description: The protruding horn on its head is very hard. It is used for bashing through thick ice.

pokemons.name: Dewgong
pokemons.description: Stores thermal energy in its body. Swims at a steady 8 knots even in intensely cold waters.

pokemons.name: Grimer
pokemons.description: Appears in filthy areas. It thrives by sucking up polluted sludge that is pumped out of factories.

pokemons.name: Muk
pokemons.description: Smells so awful, it can cause fainting. Through degeneration of its nose, it lost its sense of smell.

pokemons.name: Shellder
pokemons.description: Its hard shell repels any kind of attack. It is vulnerable only when its shell is open.

pokemons.name: Cloyster
pokemons.description: For protection, it uses its harder-than-diamonds shell. It also shoots spikes from the shell.

pokemons.name: Gastly
pokemons.description: Born from gases, anyone would faint if engulfed by its gaseous body, which contains poison.

pokemons.name: Haunter
pokemons.description: By licking, it saps the victim's life. It causes shaking that won't stop until the victim's demise.

pokemons.name: Gengar
pokemons.description: Under a full moon, this Pokémon likes to mimic the shadows of people and laugh at their fright.

pokemons.name: Onix
pokemons.description: As it grows, the stone portions of its body harden to become similar to black-colored diamonds.

pokemons.name: Drowzee
pokemons.description: Puts enemies to sleep, then eats their dreams. Occasionally gets sick from eating bad dreams.

pokemons.name: Hypno
pokemons.description: When it locks eyes with an enemy, it will use a mix of PSI moves such as Hypnosis and Confusion.

pokemons.name: Krabby
pokemons.description: Its pincers are superb weapons. They sometimes break off during battle, but they grow back fast.

pokemons.name: Kingler
pokemons.description: The larger pincer has 10,000-horsepower crushing force. However, its huge size makes it unwieldy to use.

pokemons.name: Voltorb
pokemons.description: Usually found in power plants. Easily mistaken for a Poké Ball, it has zapped many people.

pokemons.name: Electrode
pokemons.description: It stores electric energy under very high pressure. It often explodes with little or no provocation.

pokemons.name: Exeggcute
pokemons.description: Often mistaken for eggs. When disturbed, they quickly gather and attack in swarms.

pokemons.name: Exeggutor
pokemons.description: Legend has it that on rare occasions, one of its heads will drop off and continue on as an Exeggcute.

pokemons.name: Cubone
pokemons.description: Wears the skull of its deceased mother. Its cries echo inside the skull and come out as a sad melody.

pokemons.name: Marowak
pokemons.description: The bone it holds is its key weapon. It throws the bone skillfully like a boomerang to KO targets.

pokemons.name: Hitmonlee
pokemons.description: When kicking, the sole of its foot turns as hard as a diamond on impact and destroys its enemy.

pokemons.name: Hitmonchan
pokemons.description: While apparently doing nothing, it fires punches in lightning-fast volleys that are impossible to see.

pokemons.name: Lickitung
pokemons.description: Its tongue spans almost seven feet and moves more freely than its forelegs. Its licks can cause paralysis.

pokemons.name: Koffing
pokemons.description: Because it stores several kinds of toxic gases in its body, it is prone to exploding without warning.

pokemons.name: Weezing
pokemons.description: It lives and grows by absorbing dust, germs, and poison gases that are contained in toxic waste and garbage.

pokemons.name: Rhyhorn
pokemons.description: Its massive bones are 1000 times harder than human bones. It can easily knock a trailer flying.

pokemons.name: Rhydon
pokemons.description: Protected by an armor-like hide, it is capable of living in molten lava of 3,600 degrees Fahrenheit.

pokemons.name: Chansey
pokemons.description: A rare and elusive Pokémon that is said to bring happiness to those who manage to catch it.

pokemons.name: Tangela
pokemons.description: Its identity is obscured by masses of thick, blue vines. The vines are said to never stop growing.

pokemons.name: Kangaskhan
pokemons.description: It raises its young in its belly pouch. It has a violent disposition and will mercilessly strike anyone that approaches its young.

pokemons.name: Horsea
pokemons.description: Known to shoot down flying bugs with precision blasts of ink from the surface of the water.

pokemons.name: Seadra
pokemons.description: Capable of swimming backwards by rapidly flapping its wing-like pectoral fins and stout tail.

pokemons.name: Goldeen
pokemons.description: Its dorsal, pecto, and tail fins wave elegantly in water. That is why it is known as the water dancer.

pokemons.name: Seaking
pokemons.description: In the autumn spawning season, they can be seen swimming powerfully up rivers and creeks.

pokemons.name: Staryu
pokemons.description: As long as the center section is unharmed, it can grow back fully even if it is chopped to bits.

pokemons.name: Starmie
pokemons.description: Its central core glows with the seven colors of the rainbow. Some people value the core as a gem.

pokemons.name: Mr. Mime
pokemons.description: If interrupted while it is miming, it will slap around the offender with its broad hands.

pokemons.name: Scyther
pokemons.description: Leaps out of tall grass and slices prey with its scythes. The movement looks like that of a ninja.

pokemons.name: Jynx
pokemons.description: It seductively wiggles its hips as it walks. It can cause people to dance in unison with it.

pokemons.name: Electabuzz
pokemons.description: Normally found near power plants, it can wander away and cause major blackouts in cities.

pokemons.name: Magmar
pokemons.description: Its body always burns with an orange glow that enables it to hide perfectly among flames.

pokemons.name: Pinsir
pokemons.description: If it fails to crush the victim in its pincers, it will swing it around and toss it hard.

pokemons.name: Tauros
pokemons.description: When it targets an enemy, it charges furiously while whipping its body with its long tails.

pokemons.name: Magikarp
pokemons.description: It is virtually worthless in terms of both power and speed. It is the most weak and pathetic Pokémon in the world.

pokemons.name: Gyarados
pokemons.description: Rarely seen in the wild. Huge and vicious, it is capable of destroying entire cities in a rage.

pokemons.name: Lapras
pokemons.description: A gentle soul that can understand human speech. It can ferry people across the sea on its back.

pokemons.name: Ditto
pokemons.description: Capable of copying an enemy's genetic code to instantly transform itself into a duplicate of the enemy.

pokemons.name: Eevee
pokemons.description: Its genetic code is irregular. It may mutate if it is exposed to radiation from element Stones.

pokemons.name: Vaporeon
pokemons.description: Lives close to water. Its long tail is ridged with a fin, which is often mistaken for a mermaid’s.

pokemons.name: Jolteon
pokemons.description: Every hair on its body starts to stand sharply on end if it becomes charged with electricity.

pokemons.name: Flareon
pokemons.description: It has a flame bag inside its body. After inhaling deeply, it blows out flames of nearly 3,100 degrees Fahrenheit.

pokemons.name: Porygon
pokemons.description: A Pokémon that consists entirely of programming code. Capable of moving freely in cyberspace.

pokemons.name: Omanyte
pokemons.description: An ancient Pokémon that was recovered from a fossil. It swims by cleverly twisting its 10 tentacles about.

pokemons.name: Omastar
pokemons.description: A prehistoric Pokémon that died out when its heavy shell made it impossible to catch prey.

pokemons.name: Kabuto
pokemons.description: A Pokémon that was resurrected from a fossil. It swam skillfully and dove to hunt for its prey.

pokemons.name: Kabutops
pokemons.description: A slim and fast swimmer. It slices its prey with its sharp sickles and drinks the body fluids.

pokemons.name: Aerodactyl
pokemons.description: A ferocious, prehistoric Pokémon that goes for the enemy's throat with its serrated saw-like fangs.

pokemons.name: Snorlax
pokemons.description: Very lazy. Just eats and sleeps. As its rotund bulk builds, it becomes steadily more slothful.

pokemons.name: Articuno
pokemons.description: A legendary bird Pokémon. It freezes water that is contained in winter air and makes it snow.

pokemons.name: Zapdos
pokemons.description: A legendary bird Pokémon. It is said to appear when the sky turns dark and lightning showers down.

pokemons.name: Moltres
pokemons.description: A legendary bird Pokémon. As it flaps its flaming wings, even the night sky will turn red.

pokemons.name: Dratini
pokemons.description: Long considered a mythical Pokémon until recently when a small colony was found living underwater.

pokemons.name: Dragonair
pokemons.description: A mystical Pokémon that exudes a gentle aura. Has the ability to change climate conditions.

pokemons.name: Dragonite
pokemons.description: It is said that this Pokémon lives somewhere in the sea and that it flies. However, it is only a rumor.

pokemons.name: Mewtwo
pokemons.description: A Pokémon created by recombining Mew's genes. It's said to have the most savage heart among Pokémon.

pokemons.name: Mew
pokemons.description: So rare that it is still said to be a mirage by many experts. Only a few people have seen it worldwide.
